alert.note: Alert for Indian River (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 28 at 8:48AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Brevard and Indian River. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to rainbands from Hurricane Ian. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palm Bay, Sebastian, Vero Beach, Fellsmere, Indian River Shores, Malabar, Sebastian Highlands, Roseland, Wabasso, Sebastian Inlet, Winter Beach, Barefoot Bay, Gifford, Vero Beach South, Vero Lake Estates, Sebastian Inlet State Park, Micco, Pointe West, Grant-Valkaria and Vero Beach Highland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
